intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium deinacladium, commonly known as the common hawkweed. It is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowering heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disk florets, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Hieracium deinacladium is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in wetlands.
